intro: Dissotidendron bussei, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries containing seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
